item.title: 波动性减弱，市场脆弱考验期权交易者
item.description: 股市并不特别动荡。但它仍然很脆弱。【原文：The stock market isn’t particularly volatile. Still, it’s fragile.】

item.title: 尼日利亚丹格特公司将把炼油厂产能提高一倍多
item.description: 尼日利亚 Dangote 炼油厂计划将产能扩大到每天 140 万桶。【原文：Nigeria’s Dangote refinery plans to expand its capacity to 1.4 million barrels a day.】

item.title: 科技巨头发布财报，牛市决胜周来临
item.description: 本周有两天很可能决定美国股市今年余下时间的走向。【原文：Two days this week are likely to dictate the direction of the US stock market for the remainder of the year.】

item.title: iPad Pro 的下一步是什么？与 iPhone 17 Pro 类似的气室
item.description: 苹果公司正在研究一种蒸汽腔体，以改善最早于 2027 年推出的 iPad Pro 的散热和性能。此外：该公司在为苹果地图引入广告的计划上取得了进展，而配备 18 英寸屏幕的可折叠 iPad 在开发过程中遇到了阻碍。【原文：Apple is working on a vapor chamber to improve cooling and performance in an iPad Pro slated for as early as 2027. Also: The company makes headway on a plan to bring ads to Apple Maps, and a foldable iPad with an 18-inch screen hits development snags.】

item.title: 特朗普访华为最受冷落的新兴市场地区带来希望
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普对东南亚的访问为该地区带来了一线希望，该地区的股票一直是新兴市场综合体中表现最差的。【原文：Donald Trump’s visit to Southeast Asia is offering a glimmer of hope for the region, whose stocks have been among the worst-performing in the emerging markets complex.】

item.title: 澳大利亚探讨修改版权法以应对人工智能挑战
item.description: 澳大利亚政府将于周一召开为期两天的会议，探讨版权框架的变化，以应对人工智能带来的挑战。【原文：The Australian government will convene a two-day meeting on Monday to explore changes to its copyright framework, as it seeks to meet the challenges posed by artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 私人信贷巨头在沙特流动性紧缩中寻找机会
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯雄心勃勃的经济多样化项目已经耗尽了银行系统的流动性，私人信贷巨头们开始在沙特阿拉伯争夺交易。【原文：The titans of private credit are beginning to jockey for deals in Saudi Arabia, where liquidity in the banking system has been drained by the kingdom’s ambitious economic diversification projects.】

item.title: 法国财富税投票推迟，政府举步维艰
item.description: 周六，法国立法者没有对社会党提出的财富税提案进行投票表决，从而推迟了在预算辩论中可能达成的妥协，这有可能推翻总理塞巴斯蒂安-勒科尔努（Sebastien Lecornu）领导的脆弱的少数派政府。【原文：French lawmakers didn’t vote on a Socialist proposal for a wealth tax Saturday, delaying a possible compromise in a budget debate that risks toppling the fragile minority government of Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu.】

item.title: 美国在达成 20% 关税协议后公布越南贸易框架细节
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普访问越南的第一天就签署或公布了一系列措施，其中包括美国周日公布的与越南达成的贸易协定的细节。【原文：The US released details of its intended trade agreement with Vietnam on Sunday, among a raft of measures signed or released during the first day of President Donald Trump’s visit to the region.】

item.title: 沙特银行在多年增长后发出贷款回落信号
item.description: 由于流动性紧张和新的银行法规使得满足信贷需求变得更具挑战性，沙特阿拉伯的银行开始出现多年来首次缩减贷款的迹象。【原文：Saudi Arabian banks are starting to show signs of pulling back on lending for the first time in years as liquidity tightness and new bank regulations make it more challenging to keep up with demand for credit.】

item.title: 贝森特称中国将 "大量 "采购美国大豆
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）周日在与中国同行会谈后表示，中国将 "大量 "购买美国大豆，这表明中美关系在可能的领导人会晤之前正在解冻。【原文：China will make “substantial” purchases of US soybeans, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Sunday after talks with Chinese counterparts, in a sign that the relations are thawing ahead of a possible leaders’ meeting.】

item.title: Gerresheimer 称自己的调查显示可能存在会计问题
item.description: 药品和化妆品包装制造商 Gerresheimer AG 表示，该公司委托进行的外部调查发现了去年可能存在的会计问题的证据，调查将继续进行。【原文：Gerresheimer AG, a maker of packaging for medicines and cosmetics, said an external investigation it commissioned has found evidence of probable accounting issues from last year and that the probe will continue.】

item.title: 卢浮宫珠宝劫案嫌犯经过一周追捕已被拘押
item.description: 作为卢浮宫博物馆珠宝劫案调查的一部分，嫌疑人已于周六晚间被捕并被拘留。【原文：Suspects have been arrested on Saturday evening and taken into custody as part of the investigation in the Louvre museum jewel heist.】

item.title: 特朗普预测与巴西卢拉的会晤将达成 "相当不错的协议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在周日会见巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦时表示，他相信他将与巴西达成一项贸易协议。【原文：President Donald Trump said he believed he would strike a trade deal with Brazil as he met with counterpart Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva on Sunday.】

item.title: 巴西航空工业公司警告关税将导致订单延迟和取消
item.description: 巴西航空工业公司（Embraer SA）警告说，如果美国总统唐纳德-特朗普实施惩罚性关税，该飞机制造商将面临订单取消和延期的困境。【原文：Embraer SA warned the aircraft manufacturer will be battling order cancellations and delays if US President Donald Trump’s punitive tariffs are implemented.】

item.title: 中国称与美国就芬太尼和船舶问题达成初步共识
item.description: 一位中国官员表示，经过两天的广泛讨论，中美两国就芬太尼和船舶征税问题达成了初步共识，世界两大经济体之间的紧张关系出现初步缓和迹象。【原文：The US and China reached a preliminary consensus on fentanyl and ship levies after two days of wide-ranging discussions, a Chinese official said, in tentative signs of easing tensions between the world’s two largest economies.】

item.title: 澳大利亚推动印太地区网络安全发展
item.description: 澳大利亚已拨出 8,350 万澳元（合 5,440 万美元）专款，用于在整个印度洋-太平洋地区建设网络安全能力，并表示随着网络犯罪变得越来越复杂和精密，全球合作是关键所在。【原文：Australia has earmarked A$83.5 million ($54.4 million) to build cyber-security capacity across the Indo-Pacific, saying global cooperation is key as online crimes become more complex and sophisticated.】

item.title: 特朗普在里根广告后表示将把加拿大关税提高 10
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布对加拿大额外征收 10%的关税，以回应安大略省对征税提出批评的广告，从而使世界上最大的双边贸易关系之一的紧张局势升级。【原文：President Donald Trump announced an additional 10% in tariffs on Canada in response to an advertisement by the province of Ontario that is critical of the levies, escalating tensions in one of the world’s biggest bilateral trade relationships.】

item.title: 七国集团其他成员观望之际，北美将降息
item.description: 未来一周，华盛顿和渥太华的政策制定者将成为焦点，这两个国家的首都可能会降息，而七国集团的其他国家则会按兵不动。【原文：Policymakers in Washington and Ottawa will take the spotlight in the coming week, with interest-rate cuts in those two capitals likely while the rest of the Group of Seven stays on hold.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长埃斯克里瓦称当前利率水平合适
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员何塞-路易斯-埃斯克里瓦表示，他对目前的借贷成本设置感到满意。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member José Luis Escrivá said he is satisfied with present settings for borrowing costs.】

item.title: 玻利维亚总统帕斯下周赴美处理燃料危机援助事宜
item.description: 玻利维亚当选总统罗德里戈-帕斯（Rodrigo Paz）表示，他将于下周前往美国，管理多边组织为缓解该国燃料危机而提供的援助。【原文：Bolivia’s President-elect Rodrigo Paz said he would travel to the US next week to manage aid from multilateral organizations aimed at easing the fuel crisis in the country.】

item.title: 埃克森美孚起诉加州，称新环保法侵犯言论自由
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司起诉加利福尼亚州，认为该州的两项新法律试图迫使其同意某种气候观点，从而违反了第一修正案，并且与联邦法规相冲突。【原文：ExxonMobil Corp. has sued California, arguing that two new state laws violate the First Amendment by trying to force it to agree to a certain climate viewpoint, and conflict with federal regulations.】

item.title: 债券数据显示最弱消费者面临更多痛苦信贷周刊
item.description: 最弱势的消费者日益陷入困境，债务投资者也开始注意到这一点。【原文：The weakest consumers are increasingly struggling, and debt investors are starting to take notice.】

item.title: 道达尔莫桑比克液化天然气项目延迟多年后将重新启动
item.description: 道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）及其合作伙伴表示，将终止莫桑比克液化天然气项目的不可抗力，为出口终端在停工多年后正式重新开工铺平道路。【原文：TotalEnergies SE and its partners will end force majeure on their liquefied natural gas project in Mozambique, paving the way for work to formally restart on the export terminal after years of suspension, the company said.】

item.title: 特朗普对安大略省里根广告的攻击有助于扩大其影响力
item.description: 在改变历史的全球政治广告组合中，有几个广告脱颖而出。【原文：In the global portfolio of political ads that changed history, a handful stand out.】

item.title: 法国社会党人提出征收财富税以挽救政府
item.description: 法国社会党在预算辩论中提交了一份范围较窄的财富税提案，作为可能的妥协方案，该提案有可能推翻总理塞巴斯蒂安-勒科尔努（Sebastien Lecornu）领导的脆弱的少数派政府。【原文：France’s Socialist Party tabled a narrower version of its wealth tax proposal as a possible compromise in a budget debate that risks toppling the fragile minority government of Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu.】

item.title: 杂货成本持续上涨，熟食价格创下新高
item.description: 如果下一个熟食三明治的午餐肉似乎有点少，那可能不是你的想象。【原文：If your next deli sandwich seems a bit short on lunchmeat, you’re probably not imagining it.】

item.title: 这不是我的第一个泡沫英伟达的熊市坚守阵地
item.description: 华尔街的许多人都喜欢把自己打扮成逆势者，但很少有人能像杰伊-戈德伯格（Jay Goldberg）这样逆流而上，他是高歌猛进的英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.【原文：Many on Wall Street like to style themselves as contrarians, but few are swimming against the current as hard as Jay Goldberg, the lone bear on high-flying Nvidia Corp.】

item.title: 自美国监管以来，稳定币在支付领域的使用猛增 70
item.description: 自今年 7 月美国通过首部监管加密货币行业的法律以来，消费者和企业正在加速使用稳定币（与美元挂钩的数字代币）进行现实世界的购买和支付。【原文：Consumers and businesses are using stablecoins - digital tokens pegged to the dollar - to make real-world purchases and payments at an accelerating pace since the July passage of the first US legislation to regulate that niche of the cryptocurrency sector.】

item.title: 特朗普的制裁有望拧紧俄罗斯石油收入的螺丝钉
item.description:
针对俄罗斯石油公司和卢克石油公司的行动旨在扼杀克里姆林宫的收入，同时又不会导致全球价格飙升。【原文：

The move against Rosneft and Lukoil is designed to choke off Kremlin revenues without causing a spike in global prices.

】
